accepted_missions.description: A series of temporal anomalies have altered the universe, merging past, present, future, and mirror timelines into one. Work with Q to investigate these anomalies, and learn how you can bring order to this chaos.
Pirates, rogue holograms, and formerly eradicated diseases are only a few of the problems plaguing this area. Handle each in turn to bring order to the region.

ship.flavor: A Maquis raider commanded by Chakotay. This vessel was destroyed after colliding with the Caretaker's array.

current_quest.name: Serious Business
current_quest.description: The Dosi have come looking to settle a debt with the Ferengi and are none too pleased to be ignored. Stop them from joining in the war!

intro.text: "Take it from me, you don't want to be in debt with the Dosi. Unfortunately, both Brunt and my brother Rom apparently owe them something, and they've come to collect. If you don't intervene, there might not be a Ferenginar left to fight over."

ship.name: Val Jean
ship.flavor: A Maquis raider commanded by Chakotay. This vessel was destroyed after colliding with the Caretaker's array.

accepted_missions.description: From renegade androids to ancient civilizations born anew, the temporal crisis has brought chaos to every corner of the galaxy. Set the standard for all Starfleet captains by dealing with each threat in turn.

current_quest.description: Investigate the sphere as thoroughly as possible while attempting to locate the Female Changeling and any other Founders hiding here.

intro.text: "Some intense thermobaric distortions going on down there, not to mention all this temporal wackiness. Watch yourselves and the Founders, if you can find 'em."

accepted_missions.description: Could the Federation be responsible for the temporal crisis? Captain Janeway can't confirm or deny she knows the answer, but she has sent Voyager's EMH to help investigate.
Q has volunteered to assist the Federation during this temporal crisis, but can he be trusted? Join legendary Starfleet captains of the past to seek help from other powerful beings.
"Standards aren't just slipping in Starfleet. They're slipping all over the Federation, particularly when it comes to equality. Your crew's going to put a stop to it."

accepted_missions.description: The temporal crisis has brought new conflict to the already fractious Klingon Empire, where vengeance, deceit, and rebellion are the least of a captain's worries. Respond to these distress calls before the Empire falls further into disorder.
Aid the crew of the Discovery in matters both personal and professional, close to home and light years away.

missions.title: Ex Astris, Scientia
missions.speaker: Admiral William T. Riker
missions.description: "The Federation wouldn't exist without Starfleet. We might be stretched thin, but I'm going to personally ensure that every officer still here is held to the same high standards I hold myself."
missions.requirement: You may only use <#808080>Common and <#50AA3C>Uncommon crew with the Starfleet trait on this Cadet Challenge.

missions.title: The United Federation
missions.speaker: Admiral William T. Riker
missions.description: "I had the honor of serving with Worf, Starfleet's first Klingon recruit, and the Enterprise was all the better for it. A diverse crew is a stronger crew, as I intend to prove."
missions.requirement: You may only use <#808080>Common</color> and <#50AA3C>Uncommon</color> crew who are <#CC0000>alien</color> or <#CC0000>part alien</color> on this Cadet Challenge.

crew.name: Lieutenant Commander Saru
crew.flavor: Chief Science Officer of the U.S.S. Shenzhou.

crew.name: Seven in Blue
crew.flavor: After being severed from the Borg Collective, Seven of Nine--now called Seven--struggled to adapt.

crew.name: Promoted Sisko
crew.flavor: Promoted to Captain, Benjamin Sisko was recognized for his accomplishments as Commander of Deep Space Nine.

crew.name: Prisoner 'Bones' McCoy
crew.flavor: Sentenced to a life of hard labor on the asteroid Rura Penthe, McCoy was rescued by Kirk and Spock.

crew.name: Boomer Mayweather
crew.flavor: Travis Mayweather was one of the first 'space boomers,' a person born in space.

crew.name: Persis
crew.flavor: A human augment, Persis developed a strong attachment to Arik Soong, who she viewed as her father.

crew.name: Security Chief Worf
crew.flavor: Security Chief for the U.S.S. Enterprise-D, he was the first Klingon to graduate from Starfleet Academy.

crew.name: Ensign Seska
crew.flavor: Serving on the Val Jean as a Maquis, Seska was later revealed to be a Cardassian operative disguised as a Bajoran.

crew.name: Ensign Crusher
crew.flavor: After passing the Starfleet Entrance Examination, Wesley Crusher was promoted to a full Ensign.

crew.name: Commander Chekov
crew.flavor: In order to recrystalize the HMS Bounty's dilithium crystals, Chekov harvested gamma rays from the Navy carrier U.S.S. Enterprise.

crew.name: Maquis Takeover Torres
crew.flavor: Torres, under the control of Teero Anaydis, helped lead a Maquis revolt on the U.S.S. Voyager.

crew.name: Telek R'Mor
crew.flavor: Conducting research near a wormhole, Telek R'Mor agreed to carry a message from the stranded U.S.S. Voyager.

crew.name: Acting Ensign Crusher
crew.flavor: After befriending and assisting The Traveler, Wesley Crusher was field promoted to Acting Ensign.

crew.name: Commander Kor
crew.flavor: Kor, son of Rynar, commanded the force occupying Organia. His conflict with Kirk helped establish the Organian peace treaty.

crew.name: CMO Pulaski
crew.flavor: Chief Medical Officer for the U.S.S. Enterprise-D in 2365, she also served on the U.S.S. Repulse.

crew.name: Cadet Nog
crew.flavor: Nog became the first Ferengi member of Starfleet, and was assigned to DS9 as part of his cadet field studies.

crew.name: KDF Alexander
crew.flavor: Joined the Rotarran as a member of the Klingon Defense Force, against his father's wishes.

crew.name: Security Chief Tuvok
crew.flavor: Security Chief for Captain Janeway, and former infiltrator of the Maquis ship Val Jean.

crew.name: Ensign Vorik
crew.flavor: An engineering officer aboard Voyager, Vorik was part of the team that developed the Delta Flyer.

crew.name: Subcommander T'Pol
crew.flavor: Assigned to the Enterprise in the 22nd century, T'Pol was essential to many of the Enterprise's missions.

crew.name: Enterprise-D Picard
crew.flavor: Captain of the legendary U.S.S. Enterprise-D, Captain Picard was key to many of the Federation's successes.

crew.name: Lt. Tasha Yar
crew.flavor: Security Chief of the U.S.S. Enterprise-D. Later killed in action by an alien lifeform.

crew.name: Dr. Reyga
crew.flavor: A brilliant Ferengi scientist, Doctor Reyga invented the metaphasic shield before his death.

crew.name: Vedek Winn Adami
crew.flavor: An outspoken member of the Vedek Assembly, Winn was a prominent member of the Bajoran theology.

crew.name: Technician Rom
crew.flavor: Younger brother of Quark, Rom found success in Deep Space Nine's Engineering crew.

crew.name: Nurse Paris
crew.flavor: Flight Controller of the U.S.S. Voyager, he was haunted by his past in the Maquis and on the U.S.S. Exeter.

crew.name: First Maje Haron
crew.flavor: Leader of the Kazon-Relora sect, Haron was killed when Maje Culluh beamed him into space.

action.name: Luck Had Nothing To Do With It

crew.name: Section 31 Reed
crew.flavor: Pushed into serving Section 31, Malcolm Reed investigated a secret Klingon program.

crew.name: Richard Castillo
crew.flavor: Helmsman of the Enterprise-C, Castillo assumed command after Captain Garrett was killed.

action.name: Not a Conversation Killer at All

crew.name: Kai Winn
crew.flavor: After the Cardassian occupation, Winn became the first new kai, and her electoral victory was accepted as the 'Will of the Prophets'.

action.name: Honor The Prophets And They Will Always Love You

crew.name: Commander Tomalak
crew.flavor: A Romulan Commander who confronted the U.S.S. Enterprise-D on several occasions.

crew.name: Captain Kasidy Yates
crew.flavor: Captain of the civilian freighter 'Xhosa', Kasidy was briefly imprisoned for smuggling Maquis cargo.

crew.name: Captain Dathon
crew.flavor: Picard and Dathon at El-Adrel.

crew.name: Mirror 'Smiley' O'Brien
crew.flavor: Leader of the Terran Rebellion, 'Smiley' O'Brien commanded the I.S.S. Defiant against the KCA.

crew.name: Tribble Uhura
crew.flavor: Uhura buys a tribble from intergalactic trader.

crew.name: Commander Tucker
crew.flavor: Chief Engineer aboard the NX-01 Enterprise, Tucker remained a hands-on officer unafraid of a little elbow grease.

crew.name: Date Night Chapel
crew.flavor: When it comes to relationship advice, Christine Chapel is the friend you need. This doesnt mean shes good at her own relationships.

crew.name: Botanist Keiko
crew.flavor: A botanist and head of the Enterprise plant biology lab, Keiko later opened a school on Deep Space 9.

crew.name: Academy Speech Burnham
crew.flavor: After over a century's absence Starfleet Academy rises again, and its now up to the new graduates to define the future of the Federation.

action.name: I Feel Like Anything is Possible

crew.name: Ensign Ogawa
crew.flavor: Head nurse of the U.S.S. Enterprise-D, Alyssa Ogawa was essential to Doctor Crusher's medical staff.

crew.name: First Maje Culluh
crew.flavor: First Maje of the Kazon-Nistrim, Culluh succeeded in capturing U.S.S. Voyager for a short time.

action.name: I Didn't Bring A Bathing Suit
Darmok And Jalad On The Ocean

crew.name: C.O.P. Janeway
crew.flavor: After guiding Voyager through seven years in the Delta Quadrant, lighting the way for the Federation's predecessor should be a simple matter.

action.name: If the Coalition of Planets Needs Us, We Are Here to Help

crew.name: George and Gracie
crew.flavor: After being rescued from whalers by Kirk and crew in 1986, these heroes saved the world in the 23rd century by singing at a deep space probe

crew.name: Commander Kruge
crew.flavor: Skipper of a bird-of-prey, Commander Kruge sought to weaponize the Genesis device for the Klingons.

crew.name: Talos IV Spock
crew.flavor: Prior to serving with Captain Kirk, Spock accompanied Captain Pike on an away mission to Talos IV.

crew.name: Returning Saru
crew.flavor: Saru leaves Kaminar and turns down a position as captain to offer Discovery his insight and support.

crew.name: Lt. Commander Scott
crew.flavor: An ingenious engineer of Scottish descent who never failed to pull Captain Kirk and the U.S.S. Enterprise out of danger.

crew.name: Lt. Thomas Riker
crew.flavor: Split from William Riker in a transporter accident, Thomas Riker was stranded alone for eight years.

crew.name: Crashed Tuvok
crew.flavor: After crashing on a moon, Tuvok attempts to care for a trio of stranded and frightened children while repairing his shuttle.

crew.name: Dr. Phlox
crew.flavor: Chief Medical Officer of the Enterprise, Phlox was a lifelong learner of every medical art.

crew.name: Bride Kasidy Danielle Yates
crew.flavor: Against the wish of the prophets, Kasidy marries Benjamin Sisko.

action.name: Well, That Almost Sounds Like A Threat

crew.name: Vic Fontaine
crew.flavor: A self-aware hologram, Vic runs the 'Vic's Las Vegas Lounge' holoprogram popular among the DS9 command staff.

action.name: The Best Is Yet To Come

crew.name: Recovering Spock
crew.flavor: Recovering on Vulcan, Commander Spock spent much time retraining his logical mind.

crew.name: Klingon Dukat
crew.flavor: After capturing a Klingon vessel, Dukat and his crew continued the Cardassian war against the Klingons on their own.

action.name: This Isn't The Only Life Available

crew.name: Constable Odo
crew.flavor: Chief of Security on Deep Space Nine, Odo was a constant presence onboard the station.

crew.name: Ransom Shran
crew.flavor: Shran calls in a favor to rescue his daughter being held for ransom.

crew.name: Lt. Jadzia Dax
crew.flavor: Science Officer of Deep Space 9, Jadzia is the latest in a line of Dax symbiont hosts.

crew.name: Dress Uniform Data
crew.flavor: In honor of Riker's and Deanna's conjugation Data took the stage and gave a performance that blew everybody away.

action.name: Oh, Blue Skies, Smiling at Meeee

crew.name: Idrin
crew.flavor: Commander of a Hirogen hunting ship, Idrin captured Tuvok and Seven of Nine.

crew.name: CMO 'Bones' McCoy
crew.flavor: Chief Medical Officer of the U.S.S. Enterprise, Leonard McCoy was a close friend of Captain Kirk.

crew.name: CMO Bashir
crew.flavor: Second in his class at Starfleet Medical, Bashir chose to do 'frontier medicine' at Deep Space Nine.

crew.name: Chief Engineer La Forge
crew.flavor: Chief Engineer of the Enterprise-D, Geordi La Forge was an important and gifted member of the crew.

crew.name: Yeoman Rand
crew.flavor: Assigned to the U.S.S. Enterprise, Yeoman Rand served faithfully in the Operations division.

crew.name: Commander Riker
crew.flavor: When off-duty, Commander Riker often held poker nights for his fellow bridge officers.

crew.name: Ensign Mayweather
crew.flavor: Helmsman of the NX-01 Enterprise, Travis Mayweather would explore new worlds alongside Captain Archer.

crew.name: Lt. Sulu
crew.flavor: Science Officer on the U.S.S. Enterprise, he would later rise to the rank of Captain onboard the U.S.S. Excelsior.

crew.name: Ensign Mariner
crew.flavor: Beckett Mariner is a command ensign on the USS Cerritos. She breaks dumb rules that shouldnt be there so she can do a better job!

crew.name: Deep Space Nine Mariner
crew.flavor: From blackmailing Quark to breaking Worfs mek'leth, what other adventures did Mariner have aboard Deep Space Nine?

action.name: Man! Its Like a New Thing Every Week With Those Guys!

crew.name: Admiral Georgiou
crew.flavor: Aboard the Discovery, Georgiou adopts the disguise of an Admiral when under inspection by the Earth Defense Force.

action.name: I Had To Make It Believable

crew.name: Comm Officer Uhura
crew.flavor: Communications Officer for the U.S.S. Enterprise, she would later be promoted to Commander on the U.S.S. Enterprise-A.

crew.name: Sniper Ezri Dax
crew.flavor: Using a modified TR-116 rifle, Ezri Dax fought a sniper's duel with Lieutenant Chu'lak on Deep Space 9.

crew.name: Crewman Tarses
crew.flavor: A Romulan-Human member of Starfleet who was assigned to the U.S.S. Enterprise-D.

crew.name: Counselor Troi
crew.flavor: Ship's counselor on the U.S.S. Enterprise-D, her empathic abilities were invaluable to the crew.

crew.name: Ensign Sato
crew.flavor: Comm Officer onboard the Enterprise, Hoshi Sato's experiences led her to create a universal linguacode.

crew.name: Bartender Quark
crew.flavor: Owner of Quark's Bar, he is one of the more colorful residents of Deep Space Nine.

crew.name: Cardassian Kira
crew.flavor: Kira was kidnapped and modified by the Obsidian Order in a plot to reveal the dissident Tekeny Ghemor.

crew.name: Will Riker
crew.flavor: First Officer for the U.S.S. Enterprise-D, William Riker went on to have a storied career in Starfleet.

crew.name: Investigator Odo
crew.flavor: Odo was pressed into service by the Cardassians during the Occupation of Bajor.

crew.name: Punk Rocker
crew.flavor: A man simply enjoying music on the bus before Spock puts an end to his unkind outbursts.

crew.name: U.S.S. Cabot Janitor
crew.flavor: An officer aboard the U.S.S Cabot was given the unfortunate task of cleaning up Larkins modified Tribbles.

crew.name: Wesley Crusher
crew.flavor: A young member of the U.S.S. Enterprise-D's crew, which he would later join as an Ensign.

crew.name: Salia
crew.flavor: Born to parents of rival factions, Salia is destined to unite her people as a neutral ruler.

action.name: Let's Not Say Goodbye Like This

crew.name: Officiant Kirk
crew.flavor: Kirk was officiating a wedding when the ship went to red alert. The marriage that should have just begun would instead end in tragedy.

action.name: All Captains Have One Happy Privilege - Uniting Two People

crew.name: Admiral Georgiou
crew.flavor: Aboard the Discovery, Georgiou adopts the disguise of an Admiral when under inspection by the Earth Defense Force.

action.name: I Had To Make It Believable

crew.name: Holodeck 3 Dr. Brahms
crew.flavor: A holographic representation of Enterprise-D warp system designer Doctor Leah Brahms.

crew.name: Commando Crusher
crew.flavor: As chief medical officer of the Enterprise, Doctor Crusher participated in the Celtris III raid.

crew.name: Sniper Ezri Dax
crew.flavor: Using a modified TR-116 rifle, Ezri Dax fought a sniper's duel with Lieutenant Chu'lak on Deep Space 9.

crew.name: Lt. Thomas Riker
crew.flavor: Split from William Riker in a transporter accident, Thomas Riker was stranded alone for eight years.

crew.name: Bartender Quark
crew.flavor: Owner of Quark's Bar, he is one of the more colorful residents of Deep Space Nine.

crew.name: Recovering Spock
crew.flavor: Recovering on Vulcan, Commander Spock spent much time retraining his logical mind.

crew.name: Comm Officer Uhura
crew.flavor: Communications Officer for the U.S.S. Enterprise, she would later be promoted to Commander on the U.S.S. Enterprise-A.

ships.name: Nova Class
ships.flavor: Designed for short-term missions of science and exploration. Features advanced sensor arrays.

ships.name: U.S.S. Defiant
ships.flavor: Initially created for use against the Borg. Equipped with ablative armor and Starfleet's first legal cloaking device.

ships.name: Constellation Class
ships.flavor: Uniquely designed with four warp nacelles. Most often deployed for exploration and defensive patrols.

ships.name: H.M.S. Bounty
ships.flavor: A Klingon bird-of-prey commandeered by Admiral James T. Kirk. Ironically named Bounty by CMO Leonard "Bones" McCoy.

ships.name: Maquis Raider
ships.flavor: A small and manueverable ship, favored by the Maquis for quick escapes and durability under hostile pursuit.

ships.name: I.S.S. Defiant
ships.flavor: Based on plans taken from the Prime Universe, the I.S.S. Defiant was built and commanded by Mirror 'Smiley' O'Brien to lead the insurgency against Regent Worf.

ships.name: U.S.S. Constellation NCC-1017
ships.flavor: Captained by Commodore Matt Decker, the U.S.S. Constellation NCC-1017 was the first Federation ship to encounter the dreaded Doomsday Machine.

shuttles.name: Fork in the Road
shuttles.description: The wealth of possibilities the temporal anomaly crisis presents to individuals throughout the galaxy has ripple effects, such as indecision or diversion from time's original path. The DTI asks your away team to come up with some potential solutions.

disputes.name: The Killing Syndrome
disputes.description: "The Hirogen have a point. What better prey for this race of career hunters than beings who can change into anything? Losing the war is looking like an even worse decision for the Dominion now."

intro.text: "The Hirogen have a point. What better prey for this race of career hunters than beings who can change into anything? Losing the war is looking like an even worse decision for the Dominion now."

reward.name: Weyoun
reward.flavor: A Vorta clone who oversaw a Jem'Hadar attack ship. Later killed after eradicating a Jem'Hadar rebellion.

milestones.text: "At least the Hirogen aren't hunting us? But seems like it's only a matter of time."
"The effects of astroforming haven't been fully studied.  No one should possess this technology."
"We were all strangers once--Federation, Xindi, Denobulan--but we can find common ground again."
"There's a golden opportunity here to disrupt the Dominion. I hope we took advantage of it."
"You are more intelligent than most prey. We will remember this, if we maintain our dominance."
"The Hirogen will only spare us if we do not prove a challenge. You court your own destruction by supporting them."
"The Alphas are impressed. Humanity may be a prey that cannot be overcome."
"The Hirogen have clearly stated their intentions to hunt. Your actions are illogical."
"You are no longer prey, Captain. Come join our hunt...."
"For the first time, the Treaty of Bajor feels like a good decision. The Hirogen will be crushed!"
"So many speak of the Dominion War as if it was still happening. You are more rational."
"You are a compassionate, even-handed solid. Perhaps there is hope for an alliance."
"You understand the way of things. May we die fighting to preserve the Founders!"
"You truly understand the threat the Hirogen pose. Help us engineer their self-destruction."

events.name: Happily Never After
events.description: Having a view of the potential future is wrecking relationships and lives in the present, as many throughout the galaxy consider whether the path they're on is the one they want to take. But what will the consequences be for the future?
events.rules:
-- Unique Maquis, Romulan, and Section 31 Faction Missions are available during the event. Open the Event to access them.
-- Using C.O.P. Janeway, any version of Kirk, Miles O'Brien, Keiko, or Romantic crew will provide a bonus to Event Faction Missions.
-- Every Event Faction Mission you succeed at earns you Event Victory Points. Collect Victory Points to unlock Event Threshold Rewards.
-- In this event, Squadrons may also compete to advance up the Squadron leaderboards. Join a Squadron to get more rewards!
events.bonus_text: Crew Bonus: C.O.P. Janeway, Kirk, Miles O'Brien, Keiko, or Romantic
events.rewards_teaser: Reach Rank 1 by gaining Victory Points from Event Missions!

screens.text: "Dearly beloved, we are gathered here today, in spite of the temporal crisis raging around us - and perhaps because of it - to cement that most precious tie any two humanoids can share: love. Do you, Miles O'Brien, take Keiko as your lawfully wedded wife?"

"Well I don't. Keiko, Captain Kirk, I'm sorry. It's just...with all these versions of myself, I've seen glimpses of the future. I love you, Keiko, but there are so many different paths for me. I'm just...not sure this is the one I want right now."

"There he goes. I'm sorry, Keiko. Cold feet on a wedding day is not unusual, but especially with all the future possibilities right in front of you like this... I doubt the O'Briens are the only ones facing this sort of turmoil. Can you give us a hand, Captain?"

supremium_rewards.name: Dilithium
supremium_rewards.flavor: Dilithium is your most valuable asset. Use Dilithium in the Time Portal to acquire valuable crew members, items, and more.

rewards.name: Tokens
rewards.flavor: Requisition Shuttle Tokens grant access to an additional Shuttle to use for a single Faction Mission.

rewards.name: ISM
rewards.flavor: ISM, or interstellar medium, is the matter that exists between astronomical objects. It can be manipulated by the Q to facilitate crew retrieval. ISM can be obtained from Daily Log-in Rewards, Campaigns and participating in Fleet activities.
